If voting machine vendor CEOs and their companies do not make campaign contributions to ensure free and fair elections, why would congress mandate campaign contributions from corporate fines in Dem’s #HR1? 

Watch exchange w/ @RodneyDavis & voting machine vendors in clip below pic.twitter.com/QXSsI129vm

Top Republican @RodneyDavis asked the 3 voting machine vendor CEOs from @essvote @dominionvoting @HartInterCivic 
“Is there ANY method of voting that is 100% secure?” 

Their answer: No. 
#electionsecurity

Top Republican @RodneyDavis noted “centralized voter registration systems” were a primary target of foreign actors in 2016 election and asked CEO of ES&S if he finds it concerning that there are no security requirements for these election systems in current law.

Answer: Yes.

Ranking Member @RodneyDavis asked the 3 voting machine vendor CEO’s if any of their vote-tallying machines have been breeched or hacked by a foreign state. 
Their answer: No.

We want you to hear from the people who make the voting machines you could be using in the 2020 elections

Be sure to tune into our hearing on #electionsecurity now via livestream: https://youtu.be/Y15D19usS0g

“A fundamental right of our nation is the ability to choose our leaders. The American people deserve to have that right protected. We should secure and protect our nation’s elections without partisan politics” - @RodneyDavis during our hearing on #electionsecurity
Did you know that since 2018, Congress has appropriated over $800 million total to states, so they can bolster their election security efforts and replace outdated voting tech? #electionsecurity

“Instead of getting into a winded debate today between paper vs. electronic or state vs. federal, let’s instead focus our efforts on areas within our federal reach that need improvement, areas where we may come to a bipartisan agreement as we’ve seen in the past.” @RodneyDavis

“While we have faith in the electoral system, we still have a responsibility to strengthen the relationship between states and the federal government to ensure that Americans’ votes are, and will continue to be, protected.” - Ranking Member @RodneyDavis during opening statement
